content: Cantonese leaf-wrapped dim sum **Lo mai gai**[a] ([Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 糯米雞; [Jyutping](/wiki/Jyutping): *no6 mai5 gai1*; [Cantonese Yale](/wiki/Yale_romanization_of_Cantonese): *noh mái gāi*), literally "glutinous rice chicken", is a classic [dim sum](/wiki/Dim_sum) dish served during [yum cha](/wiki/Yum_cha). The portion size of *lo mai gai* is generally quite large, so there is a smaller variant created known as ***jan ju gai*** ([Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 珍珠雞; [Jyutping](/wiki/Jyutping): *zan1 zyu1 gai1*; [Cantonese Yale](/wiki/Yale_romanization_of_Cantonese): *jān jyū gāi*; lit. 'pearl chicken'). ## Description Lo mai gai is mostly a [southern Chinese](/wiki/Northern_and_southern_China) food. It contains glutinous rice filled with chicken, [Chinese mushrooms](/wiki/Shiitake), [Chinese sausage](/wiki/Chinese_sausage), [scallions](/wiki/Scallion), and sometimes dried [shrimp](/wiki/Shrimp) or salted egg. The ball of rice is then wrapped in a re-hydrated [lotus](/wiki/Nelumbo_nucifera) leaf and steamed. ## Gallery - [Bánh chưng](/wiki/B%C3%A1nh_ch%C6%B0ng) - [Bánh tét](/wiki/B%C3%A1nh_t%C3%A9t) - [Bánh tẻ](/wiki/B%C3%A1nh_t%E1%BA%BB) - [Chinese sticky rice](/wiki/Chinese_sticky_rice) - [Corunda](/wiki/Corunda) - [Hallaca](/wiki/Hallaca) - [Otak-otak](/wiki/Otak-otak) - [Pamonha](/wiki/Pamonha) - [Pasteles](/wiki/Pasteles) - [Suman](/wiki/Suman_(food)) - [Tamale](/wiki/Tamale) - [Zongzi](/wiki/Zongzi) ## Notes
title: Lo mai gai
